Hyundai Veloster 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Hyundai Veloster 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Hyundai Veloster changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Hyundai Veloster 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

Hyundai Veloster is a sports car that has much more to offer than sporty look. It is spacious though has three doors. Driving this car will give you the feeling of rocking behind a sports car.

Hyundai Veloster was first introduced in the production market in 2011. The following year, in 2012, the Veloster Turbo version came in, some changes were done to the body panels and exhausts to incorporate twin exhausts. In 2014, this model welcomed the RE: FLEX edition and significant changes were applied to the lights. The taillights and head lights were all LED. The latest version of the Veloster is the 2016 Rally edition. Just as the name suggests it, this Hyundai Veloster is made just for a rally. The changes made in the rally version: the steering wheel was stiffened, some carbon fibre side accents were added, and the roof was changed to metal.

A 1.6-liter engine is what each and every version of Veloster possesses. The engine is a four-cylinder which maximizes direct-inject. When it comes to the horsepower and 0-60 acceleration, everything changes. Not surprisingly, those two depend on the type of the engine.  GDi, MDi and an MDi turbo are the three engine options that the Hyundai Veloster offers. An automatic Veloster with a GDi provides 0-60 acceleration in 11.5 seconds whereas a manual takes 10.7 seconds.

On the other hand, an automatic Veloster with an MDi engine takes about 10.3 seconds to hit that 0-60 acceleration, but the manual takes 9.7 seconds. Turbo boosts up and makes things interesting. That is why the 0-60 timelapse of an MDi turbo engine is the best. An automatic Veloster with an MDi turbo engine manages the 0-60 acceleration in 8.1 seconds whereas a manual beats it in 7.4 seconds.

The look of the Veloster is on a whole new level. Except for the rally version, the other Veloster versions have sunroofs. It is satisfying to have natural light shining in the car and a refreshing breeze blowing in.  The alloy rims which are 18’’ big have that classy and sporty look. Veloster is not that heavy, the different versions have weight ranges from 1100kg- 1400kgs.It is not a coincidence that the turbo version has much weight.  

Hyundai Veloster is unique; its three-door feature gives that privilege. In addition to that, the variation in colors is also worth it to bring about diversification. Good performance is another feature you get from this car especially when it comes to the turbo version, from the information above you can agree.

The Drawback of Hyundai Veloster is a low roof. This inconveniences you when getting in the car. Likewise, the back seats are not that much spaced as you think. But after all, Hyundai Veloster is a great car.
